custom.4720: We held our second ever Season Show - British Invasion at the Barnyard Theatre Willowbridge on Saturday 5th December.  This Season Show saw students from our Rock 101 programme (8-10 year olds), our Performance Programme (11-18 year olds) and our Adult Performance Programme (19+) performing songs by The Kinks, Rolling Stones, The Animals, Queen, The Beatles, Cold Play, Mumford & Sons, Black Sabbath and Amy Winehouse to name but a few of the British legends.  The students performed to over 470 people and rocked the stage, all of them having learnt the songs only 2-3 months prior and many being new to School of Rock.  It always amazes us how they grow each and every time they are exposed to the stage both in confidence and technical ability....future Rock Stars!

custom.4722:
In support of one of our School of Rock parents charities - The Lewis family (Tanya, Alan, Kayla and Callum), we will be putting on a festive and fun performance for the children and families of The Red Cross Children's Hospital in the G1 Ward on Wednesday 9th December @ 10:30am - 11:30am.

You are welcome to come and watch the performance.

The G1 ward is the Haematology and Oncology Clinic, which caters for all children with cancer and blood disorders requiring investigation. The hospital is also the major reference and treatment centre for children with bleeding disorders.
custom.4723:
School of Rock will be performing at the V&A Waterfront Amphitheatre on Friday 27th November from 6pm - 7:30pm.  Our Rock 101 and select Performance Programme students will be taking the stage.

Please come and support our talented students at this FREE concert, where we will be sharing the stage with an upcoming young band called The Stoked.
custom.4728: High professionalism in teaching. Child, youth and adult friendly. Challenging students to improve and to grow. There is a place for people to form a band, and then also to perform. Your public performances give students and musicians an opportunity to experience being part of a concert and being on stage, and to show-case their talents (of which there are many!).
custom.4729: School of Rock Claremont is awesome! Its about time we introduce music/learning/skillfully equipping kids in this manner. The way you merge teaching theory and practical to the younger rookies keeps the kids wanting more. Your environment is so contagious even I love it ;-) well done and keep up the good work :-)

custom.4745: Find your inner rocker at School of Rock Claremont Cape Town. From Guitar & drums to singing lessons, have fun while you learn! 1st Lesson Free!
custom.4746:
Welcome to your one-and-only stop for seriously fun, lasting music education – School of Rock Claremont. With passionate instructors, an impressive selection of instruments, and killer program offerings, School of Rock Claremont equips students with the tools they need to rock their worlds.

Music is about way more than solo acts. School of Rock Claremont is as focused on community, teamwork, and friendships as it is on inspiring awesome music. Through our performance-based approach, we foster an inclusive community of rockers in Claremont to build a unique type of confidence only gained through cool, real life experiences. Whether we’re in serious shredding-mode or just jamming along with the band, our team spurs the growth of real, practical skills for music-minded students.

At School of Rock Claremont, we believe everyone deserves to have fun and feel like a rock star. Visit us and get a feel for the awesome opportunities your child has waiting just around the corner.

4797.description: Our Reggae Funk Season Show is taking place on Saturday 9th April @ Zip Zap Circus in the CBD. This is an exciting new venue for us, which has seen the likes of the Parlotones and Freshly Ground performing their over the past few years. In true circus style Zip Zap circus have Hot Dog stands, Cold Drink stands, Popcorn and other treat stands where you are able to purchase snacks prior to the show commencing, during the interval and after the show. Tickets are R120 and all ages welcome.

4798.description: At School of Rock, we have a unique approach to teaching music that helps kids blossom in unimaginable ways. Our performance program gives every kid who participates the opportunity to work with a team and perform live in front of an audience. And along the way, they learn to work toward a goal, go outside their comfort zone, and kill a riff from "Kashmir".

4799.description: The days of stuffy old music instruction and heaps of sheet music are over - at School of Rock, we believe that playing real music is the only real path to proficiency and lasting appreciation. Our experienced instructors are passionate about creating a legacy of music for the future by helping your kids succeed.

4800.description: We offer programs for all levels of musical experience. From Rock 101 to AllStars, we are all about equipping aspiring musicians with the right gear to grow into passionate and successful performers in a real-world setting.

custom.4801: Come and check out our third Season Show...
custom.4851: School of Rock,Claremont,Cape Town,guitar,music lesson,rock band,drums,piano,vocals,bass
custom.4889:
At School of Rock Claremont, our Performance Program puts our students front-and-center on a real stage for real performances. Students get to show off their killer music skills while learning serious teamwork as they and their bandmates refine their abilities through some of rock and roll’s greatest hits.

Claremont students will blow your mind with advanced performances chock-full of hits by famous artists such as Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, Van Halen, The Rolling Stones, AC/DC, Frank Zappa, Queen, and many, many more! For our students, real performances breed real skill, and real fun. 

All students in Claremont’s Performance Program can expect:

• Weekly private music lessons on guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals
• Weekly band rehearsal to get students prepared for real shows
• The experience of performing on stage with their band at real venues
• Key learning in fundamental areas such as stage performance, harmonies, musicianship, and more
• Fun, music, and education wrapped into one all-inclusive experience!
custom.4890:
Our Rock 101 Program at School of Rock Claremont is focused on making the first steps of a young student’s journey both fun and successful. The days of mundane music instruction are over.  At School of Rock Claremont, we believe that playing music together is the only real path to mastering an instrument and developing a true love for music.

In Rock 101, we focus our instruction on the one instrument that students have chosen to study. Whether we’re teaching scales, chords, notes, or time signatures, we put concepts in context so students understand how the principles they learn are applied to real music. Using some of the world’s most famous songs and infusing fun into every chord, Rock 101 allows Claremont students to enhance their skills and move on to our Performance Program.

School of Rock Claremont’s Rock 101 students can expect:  

• Weekly private music lessons on guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals
• Weekly group rehearsals to reinforce basic concepts and skills in a band setting
• A firm grasp of the fundamentals of technique and music theory
• An understanding of what it means to play solo and in a group
• Real knowledge gained through real fun!
custom.4891:
Our top performers can audition for School of Rock Claremont’s most prestigious honor: a spot in our AllStars program! School of Rock’s AllStars represent the best of the best from School of Rock’s global network of schools and students. Equipped with incredible musical abilities, killer work ethics and leadership skills, our AllStars have the talent and drive to grow into the next generation of musical greats.

Every summer, our AllStars embark on an authentic concert tour for a one-of-a-kind experience. Our Claremont musicians perform with All Star bands in multiple live shows at high-profile venues across the country, including Red Rocks, Lollapalooza, Hangout Music Fest, NAMM, Gathering of the Vibes, and countless others. AllStars also get to share the stage and learn from music legends like Alice Cooper, Eddie Vedder, and Slash, to name a few. The AllStars experience gives aspiring musicians the best glimpse of what a professional music career is like.

AllStars selected from School of Rock Claremont can expect:

• Real-world performances where they can master their skills on guitar, bass, drums, keyboard and/or vocals  
• An authentic tour experience with multiple live shows in various cities
• Taking the stage with the best of the best from School of Rock’s global community
• A chance to perform at legendary events and venues, side-by-side with top artists
• A truly epic rock experience like no other!
custom.4892:
At School of Rock Claremont, we know how to bring the world of music, and the fun that comes with it, to adults. We get our students playing and learning at rapid-fire speeds through real performances of their favorite songs, instead of your old traditional music instruction programs with piles of sheet music and hours of rote memorization. At School of Rock Claremont, the stage can be yours at any age.

Our adult students learn the fundamentals of music, including scales, chords, notes, progressions, and more, from real-world instruction through some of the most iconic songs and sounds in music history. Whatever your musical taste may be, our instructors know how to create a program just for you. Whether you’re seeking basic proficiency, a standing gig as the resident guitar player at parties, or future rock star status, School of Rock Claremont works with you to help you reach your goals.

Students in School of Rock Claremont’s Adult Program can expect:

• Fast-paced instruction on the instrument of your choice: guitar, bass, drums, keyboard, and/or vocals
• Weekly private instruction catered to your goals and level of proficiency
• All-adult rehearsals to prepare for real performances in local venues
• A firm grasp of music theory and technique fundamentals, taught through your favorite music genre
• Fun, instruction, and great progression of practical skills wrapped all into one!
custom.4893:
School of Rock Claremont’s Rookies Program is designed for first and second graders to provide a fun introduction to music fundamentals. Among other tools, we use proprietary setups for guitar, bass, drums and keyboard to provide a gateway to understanding music. The skills and passion for music that we teach our students gets them ready for Rock 101 and a lasting appreciation for music.

Our Claremont Rookies learn the fundamental concepts of pitch, rhythm, form and dynamics with age-appropriate exercises, tools and games. We encourage our students to explore a variety of instruments and play styles so they can get familiar with all parts of the musical landscape; even the most incredible solo guitar players or drummers need to understand how the rest of the band works together.

All students in Claremont’s Rookies Program can expect:  

• Weekly group lessons using guitar, bass, keyboard and drums
• Exposure to essential fundamentals like music theory, pitch and rhythm
• A focus on teamwork and collaboration
• An understanding of what it means to play solo and in a group
• Fun combined with practical learning!
custom.4894:
Our preschool-aged Little Wing students at School of Rock Claremont learn the creativity, confidence, and lasting experience they need to grow into life-long lovers and practitioners of music. Our exclusive approach to music education opens new doors of fun and excitement for children, from teamwork to the joy of rocking out on a favorite instrument. We create a safe, inclusive environment where music and learning work hand-in-hand to foster amazing growth in our Claremont Rookies.

Little Wing students at School of Rock Claremont enjoy a broad assortment of music-centric games based on some of the most recognizable music in rock and roll history. With great music, a solid foundation in fun, and an environment that fosters real friendships, our students get an opportunity to grow like nowhere else.

All Students in Claremont’s Little Wing Program can expect:  

• Exploration of hand percussion and other tools to spark their imagination
• Unique and engaging music games
• Teamwork, cooperation, and group music activities
• Fundamental skills for music and life
• Fun and practical learning combined, perfectly tailored to growing minds!

custom.8301:
School of Rock Claremont’s music camps and workshops are designed to bring out the best performance in a fast-paced learning environment. Just like our standard programs, our camps offer a high-energy experience that is fun, creative and team-oriented. Our students learn music by playing it with their peers, guided by experienced instructors from the music community.

From basic Performance Boot Camps to more advanced Guitar Building and Songwriting Training, School of Rock offers opportunities for musicians of all skill levels. Camps vary by location, so please contact us for a current list of camps and workshops at School of Rock Claremont.

Regardless of which camp they choose, students can expect: 
• Hands-on skill building for guitar, bass guitar, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals 
• One-on-one interaction with seasoned music professionals 
• A deeper appreciation for music theory and fundamentals 
• Greater confidence, collaboration and improvisation abilities 
• A fun and interactive experience

custom.4717: School of Rock Macarthur WINS Local Business Award
custom.4718: Sydney Weekender is coming to School of Rock
custom.4720: This Season we tackle the music of The Who and Rolling Stones along with Creedence Clearwater Revival, David Bowie and Pink Floyd. Take your musical journey further through our Performance Program.
custom.4721: On Wednesday 3rd June, 2015 the local businesss community congregated at West's Leagues Club in Leumeah to celebrate the 2015 Local Business Awards.During the night many small local businesses received awards in the categories of Best Cafe, Best Specialist Service, Best Butcher etc.We were especially proud to have been nominated as a Finalist in the Category of Best Education Service. On Wednesday night in front of over 600 people School of Rock Macarthur was awarded the Best Education Service in Campbelltown.We are very proud to have been nominated and were over the moon when our name was announced. This is a huge credit to the staff at School of Rock Macarthur who make this place an amazing haven for kids in the local area to feel safe and express their love of music.
custom.4722: Sydney Weekender came to film their show from School of Rock Macarthur on the 21st April 2015. Mike Whitney and the team hung out at School of rock and learned about all the cool activities and programs we have for the Macarthur area. They commenced filming around 12pm and continued onto the Macarthur Tavern where the School of Rock students rocked out a live performance until 9pm. Rock n Roll is here to stay in Macarthur and the kids of the area are doing an awesome job defending the faith.
custom.4728: Blown away by the talent of the students ... My daughter joined SOR only a few months ago. I already see a huge improvement in her performance. She has gained so much confidence. Thank you School of Rock.
custom.4729: School of Rock. The best music school anywhere. This whole idea of getting kids not just taking lessons and learning notes and chords, but learning songs and playing with other young musicians, and getting out on stage… I was so impressed that my daughter Cheyenne goes to School of Rock on Long Island.
custom.4730:
Our boys are loving this. The school provides a great opportunity for young musicians to meet, try out different instruments and play as a band.
Wish this was around when I was a kid!!!!
custom.4731: Our son explored many other extra-curricular activities prior to SOR, and no other activity was able to keep his interest. He has been challenged with new material, gained a foundation in theory and songwriting, as well as learned how to work in a group with other students to put on phenomenal rock 'n roll concerts in real" concert venues."

custom.4745: Find your inner rocker at School of Rock Campbelltown. From Guitar & drums to singing lessons, have fun while you learn! 1st Lesson Free!
custom.4746:
Welcome to School of Rock Macarthur, where students learn to rock their worlds. Perfectly poised in the heart of Macarthur’s bustling music ecosystem, School of Rock Macarthur has the right teachers, instruments, and programs your student needs to jam their way to success.

School of Rock isn’t just about creating killer musicians with a lasting love for all things rock. Because life isn’t a solo act, we’re equally focused on creating awesome bands of friends and musicians. We’re as much about orchestrating a community in Macarthur full of cool experiences as we are about building confidence, extraordinary teamwork, and achieving excellence through our unique teaching method.

Everyone deserves to feel like a rock star. Welcome to a place where students learn to create face-melting music while developing the skills they need to do so much more.

custom.4889:
School of Rock Macarthur's Performance Program is all about translating our students' abilities to play in the lesson room to performing for real on stage. In addition to refining their overall skill and proficiency as musicians, students learn what comes with being part of a band: teamwork, collaboration, and the special brand of fun that only comes from sharing awesome experiences with others.

Students learn, absorb, and perform iconic hits from some of history's greatest rock and roll performers including The Rolling Stones, The Beatles, Van Halen, AC/DC, Led Zeppelin and many more. No matter what they perform, our students will learn incredible skills and enjoy epic experiences that will last a lifetime.

All students in Macarthur's Performance Program can expect:

• Weekly private music lessons on guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals 
• Weekly band rehearsal to get students prepared for real shows
• Real-life performances on stage at amazing venues
• Advanced instruction in fundamentals such as stage performance, harmonies, musicianship, and more
• Fun, music, and education wrapped into one all-inclusive experience!
custom.4890:
Our Rock 101 Program at School of Rock Macarthur is focused on making the first steps of a young student’s journey both fun and successful. The days of mundane music instruction are over.  At School of Rock Macarthur, we believe that playing music together is the only real path to mastering an instrument and developing a true love for music.

In Rock 101, we focus our instruction on the one instrument that students have chosen to study. Whether we’re teaching scales, chords, notes, or time signatures, we put concepts in context so students understand how the principles they learn are applied to real music. Using some of the world’s most famous songs and infusing fun into every chord, Rock 101 allows Macarthur students to enhance their skills and move on to our Performance Program.

School of Rock Macarthur’s Rock 101 students can expect:  

• Weekly private music lessons on guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals
• Weekly group rehearsals to reinforce basic concepts and skills in a band setting
• A firm grasp of the fundamentals of technique and music theory
• An understanding of what it means to play solo and in a group
• Real knowledge gained through real fun!
custom.4891:
School of Rock Macarthur’s top students can audition for our most prestigious honor: the School of Rock AllStars Program. Our AllStars represent the best of the best students from School of Rock’s entire global network of schools. With incredible musical aptitude, a knack for teamwork and incredible focus, today’s AllStars truly represent the future of rock and roll.

Each summer, our AllStars embark on an authentic concert tour to perform in jaw-dropping live shows across the country, including Red Rocks, Lollapalooza, Hangout Music Fest, NAMM, Gathering of the Vibes, and countless others. AllStars also get to share the stage with experienced, larger-than-life performers like Alice Cooper, Eddie Vedder, and Slash, to name a few. There is no better way for a star on the rise to get a taste for what professional music is really like.

School of Rock Macarthur’s AllStars can expect: 

• Real-world performances where they can shine in their chosen medium: guitar, bass, drums, keyboard, and/or vocals
• A fast-paced tour experience with stage shows at legendary events and venues
• To play with the best performers from School of Rock’s global community
• The opportunity to rock out on stage with world-renowned artists
• An epic rock experience like no other!
custom.4892:
At School of Rock Macarthur, we know how to bring the world of music, and the fun that comes with it, to adults. We get our students playing and learning at rapid-fire speeds through real performances of their favorite songs, instead of your old traditional music instruction programs with piles of sheet music and hours of rote memorization. At School of Rock Macarthur, the stage can be yours at any age.

Our adult students learn the fundamentals of music, including scales, chords, notes, progressions, and more, from real-world instruction through some of the most iconic songs and sounds in music history. Whatever your musical taste may be, our instructors know how to create a program just for you. Whether you’re seeking basic proficiency, a standing gig as the resident guitar player at parties, or future rock star status, School of Rock Macarthur works with you to help you reach your goals.

Students in School of Rock Macarthur’s Adult Program can expect:

• Fast-paced instruction on the instrument of your choice: guitar, bass, drums, keyboard, and/or vocals
• Weekly private instruction catered to your goals and level of proficiency
• All-adult rehearsals to prepare for real performances in local venues
• A firm grasp of music theory and technique fundamentals, taught through your favorite music genre
• Fun, instruction, and great progression of practical skills wrapped all into one!
custom.4893:
School of Rock Macarthur’s Rookies Program offers a gateway to understanding music for first and second graders. Using proprietary set-ups for guitar, bass, drums and keyboard, as well as other tools, we introduce our Rookies to music fundamentals in a fun way. The skills and passion for music that our Rookies learn prepares them for Rock 101 and a lifelong love of music.

With exercises, tools and games customized to their age group, our (geomodifer) Rookies learn the concepts of music theory, rhythm, pitch, form and dynamics as they play alongside their friends. We encourage our students to explore various instruments and play styles so they begin to understand how individual contributions form a band; even the best solo keyboard players or vocalists need to understand how an ensemble works.

All students in Macarthur’s Rookies Program can expect:  

• Weekly group lessons using guitar, bass, keyboard and drums
• Exposure to essential fundamentals like music theory, pitch and rhythm
• A focus on teamwork and collaboration
• An understanding of what it means to play solo and in a group
• Fun combined with practical learning!
custom.4894:
At School of Rock Macarthur, we teach preschoolers in our Little Wing Program the creativity, confidence, and knowledge they need to grow into life-long lovers and practitioners of music. Music is the gateway to childrens’ growth, whether it’s in the form of great friendships from shared musical experiences or the joy of hearing an inspirational song for the first time.

Our Little Wing students at Macarthur enjoy a unique variety of music-minded games based on some of the most popular music in rock and roll history. Through great music and a foundation of fun, our students refine their motor skills, coordination, pre-literacy, and group cooperation in a safe and inclusive environment.

Young rockers in Macarthur’s Little Wing Program can expect:  

• Exploration of hand percussion and other tools to spark their imagination
• Unique and engaging music games
• Teamwork, cooperation, and group music activities
• Fundamental skills for music and life
• Fun and practical learning combined, perfectly tailored to growing minds!
custom.8301:
School of Rock Macarthur’s music camps and workshops are designed to bring out the best performance in a fast-paced learning environment. Just like our standard programs, our camps offer a high-energy experience that is fun, creative and team-oriented. Our students learn music by playing it with their peers, guided by experienced instructors from the music community.

From basic Performance Boot Camps to more advanced Guitar Building and Songwriting Training, School of Rock offers opportunities for musicians of all skill levels. Camps vary by location, so please contact us for a current list of camps and workshops at School of Rock Macarthur.

Regardless of which camp they choose, students can expect: 
• Hands-on skill building for guitar, bass guitar, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals 
• One-on-one interaction with seasoned music professionals 
• A deeper appreciation for music theory and fundamentals 
• Greater confidence, collaboration and improvisation abilities 
• A fun and interactive experience

customByName.Meta Description: Find your inner rocker at School of Rock Campbelltown. From Guitar & drums to singing lessons, have fun while you learn! 1st Lesson Free!

customByName.News Item 1 - Body: This Season we tackle the music of The Who and Rolling Stones along with Creedence Clearwater Revival, David Bowie and Pink Floyd. Take your musical journey further through our Performance Program.
customByName.News Item 2 - Body: On Wednesday 3rd June, 2015 the local businesss community congregated at West's Leagues Club in Leumeah to celebrate the 2015 Local Business Awards.During the night many small local businesses received awards in the categories of Best Cafe, Best Specialist Service, Best Butcher etc.We were especially proud to have been nominated as a Finalist in the Category of Best Education Service. On Wednesday night in front of over 600 people School of Rock Macarthur was awarded the Best Education Service in Campbelltown.We are very proud to have been nominated and were over the moon when our name was announced. This is a huge credit to the staff at School of Rock Macarthur who make this place an amazing haven for kids in the local area to feel safe and express their love of music.
customByName.News Item 2 - Title: School of Rock Macarthur WINS Local Business Award
customByName.News Item 3 - Body: Sydney Weekender came to film their show from School of Rock Macarthur on the 21st April 2015. Mike Whitney and the team hung out at School of rock and learned about all the cool activities and programs we have for the Macarthur area. They commenced filming around 12pm and continued onto the Macarthur Tavern where the School of Rock students rocked out a live performance until 9pm. Rock n Roll is here to stay in Macarthur and the kids of the area are doing an awesome job defending the faith.
customByName.News Item 3 - Title: Sydney Weekender is coming to School of Rock

customByName.Testimonial 1 - Body: Blown away by the talent of the students ... My daughter joined SOR only a few months ago. I already see a huge improvement in her performance. She has gained so much confidence. Thank you School of Rock.
customByName.Testimonial 2 - Body: School of Rock. The best music school anywhere. This whole idea of getting kids not just taking lessons and learning notes and chords, but learning songs and playing with other young musicians, and getting out on stage… I was so impressed that my daughter Cheyenne goes to School of Rock on Long Island.
customByName.Testimonial 3 - Body:
Our boys are loving this. The school provides a great opportunity for young musicians to meet, try out different instruments and play as a band.
Wish this was around when I was a kid!!!!

customByName.News Item 1 - Body: The last season concert proved to be a huge success as SOR students rock out to their favorite rock tunes by American artists!
customByName.News Item 1 - Title: Rockin' in the USA Season Concert a Rockin' Success!!
customByName.Pages Description:
Welcome to School of Rock Philippines, where students learn to rock their worlds. Perfectly poised in the heart of Philippines’s bustling music ecosystem, School of Rock Philippines has the right teachers, instruments, and programs your student needs to jam their way to success.

School of Rock isn’t just about creating killer musicians with a lasting love for all things rock. Because life isn’t a solo act, we’re equally focused on creating awesome bands of friends and musicians. We’re as much about orchestrating a community in Philippines full of cool experiences as we are about building confidence, extraordinary teamwork, and achieving excellence through our unique teaching method.

Everyone deserves to feel like a rock star. Welcome to a place where students learn to create face-melting music while developing the skills they need to do so much more.
customByName.Program Text - Adult Prog:
At School of Rock Philippines, we know how to bring the world of music, and the fun that comes with it, to adults. We get our students playing and learning at rapid-fire speeds through real performances of their favorite songs, instead of your old traditional music instruction programs with piles of sheet music and hours of rote memorization. At School of Rock Philippines, the stage can be yours at any age.

Our adult students learn the fundamentals of music, including scales, chords, notes, progressions, and more, from real-world instruction through some of the most iconic songs and sounds in music history. Whatever your musical taste may be, our instructors know how to create a program just for you. Whether you’re seeking basic proficiency, a standing gig as the resident guitar player at parties, or future rock star status, School of Rock Philippines works with you to help you reach your goals.

Students in School of Rock Philippines’s Adult Program can expect:

• Fast-paced instruction on the instrument of your choice: guitar, bass, drums, keyboard, and/or vocals
• Weekly private instruction catered to your goals and level of proficiency
• All-adult rehearsals to prepare for real performances in local venues
• A firm grasp of music theory and technique fundamentals, taught through your favorite music genre
• Fun, instruction, and great progression of practical skills wrapped all into one!
customByName.Program Text - AllStars:
School of Rock Philippines’s top students can audition for our most prestigious honor: the School of Rock AllStars Program. Our AllStars represent the best of the best students from School of Rock’s entire global network of schools. With incredible musical aptitude, a knack for teamwork and incredible focus, today’s AllStars truly represent the future of rock and roll.

Each summer, our AllStars embark on an authentic concert tour to perform in jaw-dropping live shows across the country, including Red Rocks, Lollapalooza, Hangout Music Fest, NAMM, Gathering of the Vibes, and countless others. AllStars also get to share the stage with experienced, larger-than-life performers like Alice Cooper, Eddie Vedder, and Slash, to name a few. There is no better way for a star on the rise to get a taste for what professional music is really like.

School of Rock Philippines’s AllStars can expect: 

• Real-world performances where they can shine in their chosen medium: guitar, bass, drums, keyboard, and/or vocals
• A fast-paced tour experience with stage shows at legendary events and venues
• To play with the best performers from School of Rock’s global community
• The opportunity to rock out on stage with world-renowned artists
• An epic rock experience like no other!
customByName.Program Text - Camps:
School of Rock Philippines’s music camps and workshops are designed to bring out the best performance in a fast-paced learning environment. Just like our standard programs, our camps offer a high-energy experience that is fun, creative and team-oriented. Our students learn music by playing it with their peers, guided by experienced instructors from the music community.

From basic Performance Boot Camps to more advanced Guitar Building and Songwriting Training, School of Rock offers opportunities for musicians of all skill levels. Camps vary by location, so please contact us for a current list of camps and workshops at School of Rock Philippines.

Regardless of which camp they choose, students can expect: 
• Hands-on skill building for guitar, bass guitar, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals 
• One-on-one interaction with seasoned music professionals 
• A deeper appreciation for music theory and fundamentals 
• Greater confidence, collaboration and improvisation abilities 
• A fun and interactive experience
customByName.Program Text - LittleWing:
At School of Rock Philippines, we teach preschoolers in our Little Wing Program the creativity, confidence, and knowledge they need to grow into life-long lovers and practitioners of music. Music is the gateway to childrens’ growth, whether it’s in the form of great friendships from shared musical experiences or the joy of hearing an inspirational song for the first time.

Our Little Wing students at Philippines enjoy a unique variety of music-minded games based on some of the most popular music in rock and roll history. Through great music and a foundation of fun, our students refine their motor skills, coordination, pre-literacy, and group cooperation in a safe and inclusive environment.

Young rockers in Philippines’s Little Wing Program can expect:  

• Exploration of hand percussion and other tools to spark their imagination
• Unique and engaging music games
• Teamwork, cooperation, and group music activities
• Fundamental skills for music and life
• Fun and practical learning combined, perfectly tailored to growing minds!
customByName.Program Text - Performanc:
School of Rock Philippines's Performance Program is all about translating our students' abilities to play in the lesson room to performing for real on stage. In addition to refining their overall skill and proficiency as musicians, students learn what comes with being part of a band: teamwork, collaboration, and the special brand of fun that only comes from sharing awesome experiences with others.

Students learn, absorb, and perform iconic hits from some of history's greatest rock and roll performers including The Rolling Stones, The Beatles, Van Halen, AC/DC, Led Zeppelin and many more. No matter what they perform, our students will learn incredible skills and enjoy epic experiences that will last a lifetime.

All students in Philippines's Performance Program can expect:

• Weekly private music lessons on guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals 
• Weekly band rehearsal to get students prepared for real shows
• Real-life performances on stage at amazing venues
• Advanced instruction in fundamentals such as stage performance, harmonies, musicianship, and more
• Fun, music, and education wrapped into one all-inclusive experience!
customByName.Program Text - Rock 101:
Our Rock 101 Program at School of Rock Philippines is focused on making the first steps of a young student’s journey both fun and successful. The days of mundane music instruction are over.  At School of Rock Philippines, we believe that playing music together is the only real path to mastering an instrument and developing a true love for music.

In Rock 101, we focus our instruction on the one instrument that students have chosen to study. Whether we’re teaching scales, chords, notes, or time signatures, we put concepts in context so students understand how the principles they learn are applied to real music. Using some of the world’s most famous songs and infusing fun into every chord, Rock 101 allows Philippines students to enhance their skills and move on to our Performance Program.

School of Rock Philippines’s Rock 101 students can expect:  

• Weekly private music lessons on guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals
• Weekly group rehearsals to reinforce basic concepts and skills in a band setting
• A firm grasp of the fundamentals of technique and music theory
• An understanding of what it means to play solo and in a group
• Real knowledge gained through real fun!
customByName.Program Text - Rookies:
School of Rock Philippines’s Rookies Program offers a gateway to understanding music for first and second graders. Using proprietary set-ups for guitar, bass, drums and keyboard, as well as other tools, we introduce our Rookies to music fundamentals in a fun way. The skills and passion for music that our Rookies learn prepares them for Rock 101 and a lifelong love of music.

With exercises, tools and games customized to their age group, our (geomodifer) Rookies learn the concepts of music theory, rhythm, pitch, form and dynamics as they play alongside their friends. We encourage our students to explore various instruments and play styles so they begin to understand how individual contributions form a band; even the best solo keyboard players or vocalists need to understand how an ensemble works.

All students in Philippines’s Rookies Program can expect:  

• Weekly group lessons using guitar, bass, keyboard and drums
• Exposure to essential fundamentals like music theory, pitch and rhythm
• A focus on teamwork and collaboration
• An understanding of what it means to play solo and in a group
• Fun combined with practical learning!
customByName.Testimonial 1 - Body: School of Rock has taught me how to perform in public with self-confidence.
customByName.Testimonial 2 - Body: School of Rock. The best music school anywhere. This whole idea of getting kids not just taking lessons and learning notes and chords, but learning songs and playing with other young musicians, and getting out on stage… I was so impressed that my daughter Cheyenne goes to School of Rock on Long Island.
customByName.Testimonial 3 - Body: You want your kid to be passionate about something, whether it be sports, scouts, dance or whatever. School of Rock does this for my son. We have discovered a talent we didn't know he had. My son would live at School of Rock if he could. We’ve already recommended the program to several friends.
customByName.Testimonial 4 - Body: Our son explored many other extra-curricular activities prior to SOR, and no other activity was able to keep his interest. He has been challenged with new material, gained a foundation in theory and songwriting, as well as learned how to work in a group with other students to put on phenomenal rock 'n roll concerts in real" concert venues."

custom.4720:
SIGN UP NOW 
Announcing our Summer 2016 Show Season:
PRINCE 
Mondays from 6pm to 9pm
Director: Jack Frost
Starting Monday June 20th, 2016
We have lost too many iconic artists this year and just recently Prince. Prince was a truly original trailblazer in the music industry, mixing all elements of rock, pop, soul, R&B and more into his music. On his first few records, he played more than 25+ instruments just by himself! Not only was he an amazing songwriter himself, but he wrote hit songs for other artists too. This show's playlists will include his hits like "Let's Go Crazy" "Purple Rain" "When Doves Cry" among others as well as songs he wrote for other artists like "Manic Monday", "Nothing Compares 2 U" and more.
ALTERNATIVE NATION
Tuesdays from 6pm to 9pm
Director: Charlie Corletta
Starting Tuesday June 21st, 2016
Coming off the age of hair metal, the Seattle scene blew the doors off the music industry in the early 90s. With the release of Nirvana's Nevermind in 1991, the music industry turned its ears away from the Sunset Strip and towards the dreary, cold Northwest. From this vibrant club scene, bands worked out their blend of sweaty, in your face, rock. They called it "grunge" or "alternative" in the media, even though the rock community hated those terms. This show's playlists include songs from bands like Stone Temple Pilots, Temple of the Dog, Alice in Chains (all pictured here) as well as Nirvana, Soundgarden, Smashing Pumpkins, Garbage, The Cranberries, and more.
custom.4721: School of Rock is pleased to have Charlie Corletta join their Faculty! Charlie is a professional performance/session drummer. His influences are Buddy Rich, Benny Greb, John Karel, John Bonham. He has studied and learned his discipline of drums and percussion under the professional eyes and ears of Paul Beatie, Bobby Deitch and John Hvasta. First picking up the sticks in elementary schools her he learned the basic fundamentals of percussion in concert band, marching band and district orchestra. Charlie got his professional start playing drums live at the age of 16 when his band opened for the iconic Swedish heavy metal Legends in Flames, this show set the tone for what would be Charlie's dream and passion. Touring and playing countless live shows as both a regional and national act became a constant in Corletta's life. Opening for his favorite bands and performing as a headliner himself, Charlie has experienced so many phenomenal musical and performance moments. Performing in front of crowds as small as fifteen people to as large as ten thousand, no gig has ever been too small or too large for the New York Native. Since and during that time Charlie has recorded drums and released four commercially accepted albums, appeared on numerous singles as session drummer, had regular air play on Sirius XM Liquid Metal as well as FM radio and for a short time stepped away from the drums when he became lead singer for New Jersey based extreme metal act Julius Seizure. Although drums have always been Charlie's main discipline, he is also an accomplished singer, song writer and guitarist. In 2012 Corletta was given the chance to write and publish the theme song "The Ride Of a Your Life" for History Chanel's "We're The Fugawis" television show. On this song Charlie showcased his ability to write, and perform all instruments when he recorded drums, guitar, bass, and vocals for the song. That talented has also been displayed in Charlie's heavy metal solo project The Silencer, where he writes and performs all material and all instruments on record. When Charlie isn't performing with his bands, teaching, or recording you can usually find him down in Nyack, NY on the Hudson River jamming out on open jam nights with some of the areas most sought after, top Notch'd musicians at Olives, or Casa Del Sol. "My mission is to give my students not just an education in drums but the insight, intuition, and inspiration they need to be the most confident and comfortable players to ever sit behind a drum set. I want them to know just how fun and life changing the world of drums can be when they have the ability to be the keepers of time and rhythm," said Corletta. Other qualifications: ASCAP Member Songwriter/Publisher Owner and Operator of independent DIY record label and PR Company Fallen Music Inc. Bachelors Degree in Public Relations/Journalism from SUNY New Paltz
custom.4722: School of Rock Somerville are honored to offer the prizes to the winners of this Battle of The Bands competition. Stonecrest Community Church will be holding a Battle of the Bands in conjunction with the non-profit organization Heart Support ( www.heartsupport.com ) on Friday, May 15, 2015 from 4:00pm-9:00pm . Th e purpose of th is event is to highlight the third largest cause of death among adolescents - suicide and provide options for hope. Our goal is for teens ( and their families ) who attend th is event to hear great music, listen to stories of hope and survival, and know where they or those close to them can turn for help. Our special guest speaker - Jake Luhrs , lead singer of t he popular band August Burns Red , will be speaking about how his music has been able to provide hope for teens struggling with abuse, depression and suicide. It is our desire that this event wil l have a positive impact on our high school community. In order for this event to reach its full potential, we are looking for the support of businesses such as yours. W e would greatly appreciate a donation to be used towards prizes for the winners of our Battle of the B ands contest , as well as anything we can use as door prizes for those in attendance . As a thank you for your support, your business's name will be included on a banner that will be prominently displayed on the stage during the event. Stonecrest Community Church is a 501-c3 tax exempt organization (EIN #22-1851453) , and we have worked alongside the Warren Township Youth Commission for several years in their attempts to serve the teens and their families in this area . If you have any questions, p lease contact Nithin Thompson, Director of Youth and Young A dult ministries at Stonecrest Community Church at Nithin@stonecrestchurch.com . Thank you in advance for your consideration of this request.
custom.4723: *Supporting Young Artists in New Jersey* Last year the School of Rock Somerville hosted an art exhibition for Young Artists in New Jersey, all part of the wonderful weekend in Somerville New Jersey called *ARTS ON DIVISION STREET* Having seen some of the wonderful art being dropped off at the school I know we are in for a treat this year. The artists are as young as 4 and the depth of their work is seen not only in their art but the way they present themselves when asked about the art. Come and show your support. So please visit the school. ART EXHIBITION HOURS: Friday June 19th: 5.00 - 8.00 Saturday June 20th: 12.00-5.00 Sunday June 21st: 12.00-5.00 While visiting sign up for a *Free Trial Lesson* and also receive 20% of any program.
custom.4728: I can’t tell you what an enriching experience this has been for our whole family and especially for Josh. The instructors there were so much more than teachers for Josh, they were his idols and his role models. It has been an amazing time, and I know that as Josh gets older he will look back on all the memories he made at the SOR fondly. You have created something special there, and I hope you understand what an impact your efforts have had on the lives of these children.Thank you for everything!
custom.4729: Carlson's time at School of Rock helped her recruit most of her current bandmates. It spurred her to apply to Berklee which, unlike other colleges that offer music majors geared mainly toward classical and jazz, offered the opportunity to train as a well-rounded musician.
custom.4730: School of Rock is the best thing we have done for our three children. They learn self-confidence, teamwork, and musicianship in an environment that is safe and free of the typical age-barrier restrictions that are often inherent in other student activities. The youngest and oldest kids in the school work together and everyone is an equal on stage. I wish other youth activities were as welcoming.
custom.4731: School of Rock has helped develop my daughter's self confidence. She just lights up when she is on stage. I just love watching and seeing her growth as a person and as a musician. SOR is her second family.
custom.4732: — Tim Gallagher, Father of School of Rock Denver student
custom.4733: — Chelsea Carson, student from Long Valley School of Rock
custom.4734: — Tony C., parent, Great Valley, PA

custom.4746:
Welcome to School of Rock Somerville—a haven for aspiring musicians who love rock n’ roll. We believe live performance is the most fun and effective way to teach an instrument, which is why we get kids playing on stage as quickly as possible. Our classes are tailored to all age groups and levels of proficiency, and instructors are passionate about creating a legacy of music by helping students succeed in music and beyond.
 
We also believe that music is more than a solo act. That’s why School of Rock Somerville teaches kids to play alone and as part of a team. This approach promotes accountability, speeds up the learning process, and fosters an inclusive community of rockers in Somerville. Students are not only learning an instrument—they’re making friends, building confidence, and becoming better people.

Want to know more? Visit School of Rock Somerville to get a feel for our methods and community.

His influences are Buddy Rich, Benny Greb, John Karel, John Bonham. He has studied and learned his discipline of drums and percussion under the professional eyes and ears of Paul Beatie, Bobby Deitch and John Hvasta. First picking up the sticks in elementary schools her he learned the basic fundamentals of percussion in concert band, marching band and district orchestra. Charlie got his professional start playing drums live at the age of 16 when his band opened for the iconic Swedish heavy metal Legends in Flames, this show set the tone for what would be Charlie's dream and passion. Touring and playing countless live shows as both a regional and national act became a constant in Corletta's life. Opening for his favorite bands and performing as a headliner himself, Charlie has experienced so many phenomenal musical and performance moments. Performing in front of crowds as small as fifteen people to as large as ten thousand, no gig has ever been too small or too large for the New York Native. Since and during that time Charlie has recorded drums and released four commercially accepted albums, appeared on numerous singles as session drummer, had regular air play on Sirius XM Liquid Metal as well as FM radio and for a short time stepped away from the drums when he became lead singer for New Jersey based extreme metal act Julius Seizure. Although drums have always been Charlie's main discipline, he is also an accomplished singer, song writer and guitarist. In 2012 Corletta was given the chance to write and publish the theme song "The Ride Of a Your Life" for History Chanel's "We're The Fugawis" television show. On this song Charlie showcased his ability to write, and perform all instruments when he recorded drums, guitar, bass, and vocals for the song. That talented has also been displayed in Charlie's heavy metal solo project The Silencer, where he writes and performs all material and all instruments on record. When Charlie isn't performing with his bands, teaching, or recording you can usually find him down in Nyack, NY on the Hudson River jamming out on open jam nights with some of the areas most sought after, top Notch'd musicians at Olives, or Casa Del Sol. "My mission is to give my students not just an education in drums but the insight, intuition, and inspiration they need to be the most confident and comfortable players to ever sit behind a drum set. I want them to know just how fun and life changing the world of drums can be when they have the ability to be the keepers of time and rhythm," said Corletta. Other qualifications: ASCAP Member Songwriter/Publisher Owner and Operator of independent DIY record label and PR Company Fallen Music Inc. Bachelors Degree in Public Relations/Journalism from SUNY New Paltz

customByName.News Item 3 - Body: School of Rock Somerville are honored to offer the prizes to the winners of this Battle of The Bands competition. Stonecrest Community Church will be holding a Battle of the Bands in conjunction with the non-profit organization Heart Support ( www.heartsupport.com ) on Friday, May 15, 2015 from 4:00pm-9:00pm . Th e purpose of th is event is to highlight the third largest cause of death among adolescents - suicide and provide options for hope. Our goal is for teens ( and their families ) who attend th is event to hear great music, listen to stories of hope and survival, and know where they or those close to them can turn for help. Our special guest speaker - Jake Luhrs , lead singer of t he popular band August Burns Red , will be speaking about how his music has been able to provide hope for teens struggling with abuse, depression and suicide. It is our desire that this event wil l have a positive impact on our high school community. In order for this event to reach its full potential, we are looking for the support of businesses such as yours. W e would greatly appreciate a donation to be used towards prizes for the winners of our Battle of the B ands contest , as well as anything we can use as door prizes for those in attendance . As a thank you for your support, your business's name will be included on a banner that will be prominently displayed on the stage during the event. Stonecrest Community Church is a 501-c3 tax exempt organization (EIN #22-1851453) , and we have worked alongside the Warren Township Youth Commission for several years in their attempts to serve the teens and their families in this area . If you have any questions, p lease contact Nithin Thompson, Director of Youth and Young A dult ministries at Stonecrest Community Church at Nithin@stonecrestchurch.com . Thank you in advance for your consideration of this request.

customByName.Pages Description:
Welcome to School of Rock Somerville—a haven for aspiring musicians who love rock n’ roll. We believe live performance is the most fun and effective way to teach an instrument, which is why we get kids playing on stage as quickly as possible. Our classes are tailored to all age groups and levels of proficiency, and instructors are passionate about creating a legacy of music by helping students succeed in music and beyond.
 
We also believe that music is more than a solo act. That’s why School of Rock Somerville teaches kids to play alone and as part of a team. This approach promotes accountability, speeds up the learning process, and fosters an inclusive community of rockers in Somerville. Students are not only learning an instrument—they’re making friends, building confidence, and becoming better people.

Want to know more? Visit School of Rock Somerville to get a feel for our methods and community.
customByName.Program Text - Adult Prog:
At School of Rock Somerville, we know how to bring the world of music, and the fun that comes with it, to adults. We get our students playing and learning at rapid-fire speeds through real performances of their favorite songs, instead of your old traditional music instruction programs with piles of sheet music and hours of rote memorization. At School of Rock Somerville, the stage can be yours at any age.

Our adult students learn the fundamentals of music, including scales, chords, notes, progressions, and more, from real-world instruction through some of the most iconic songs and sounds in music history. Whatever your musical taste may be, our instructors know how to create a program just for you. Whether you’re seeking basic proficiency, a standing gig as the resident guitar player at parties, or future rock star status, School of Rock Somerville works with you to help you reach your goals.

Students in School of Rock Somerville’s Adult Program can expect:

• Fast-paced instruction on the instrument of your choice: guitar, bass, drums, keyboard, and/or vocals
• Weekly private instruction catered to your goals and level of proficiency
• All-adult rehearsals to prepare for real performances in local venues
• A firm grasp of music theory and technique fundamentals, taught through your favorite music genre
• Fun, instruction, and great progression of practical skills wrapped all into one!
customByName.Program Text - AllStars:
School of Rock Somerville’s top students can audition for our most prestigious honor: the School of Rock AllStars Program. Our AllStars represent the best of the best students from School of Rock’s entire global network of schools. With incredible musical aptitude, a knack for teamwork and incredible focus, today’s AllStars truly represent the future of rock and roll.

Each summer, our AllStars embark on an authentic concert tour to perform in jaw-dropping live shows across the country, including Red Rocks, Lollapalooza, Hangout Music Fest, NAMM, Gathering of the Vibes, and countless others. AllStars also get to share the stage with experienced, larger-than-life performers like Alice Cooper, Eddie Vedder, and Slash, to name a few. There is no better way for a star on the rise to get a taste for what professional music is really like.

School of Rock Somerville’s AllStars can expect: 

• Real-world performances where they can shine in their chosen medium: guitar, bass, drums, keyboard, and/or vocals
• A fast-paced tour experience with stage shows at legendary events and venues
• To play with the best performers from School of Rock’s global community
• The opportunity to rock out on stage with world-renowned artists
• An epic rock experience like no other!
customByName.Program Text - Camps:
School of Rock Somerville’s music camps and workshops are designed to bring out the best performance in a fast-paced learning environment. Just like our standard programs, our camps offer a high-energy experience that is fun, creative and team-oriented. Our students learn music by playing it with their peers, guided by experienced instructors from the music community.

From basic Performance Boot Camps to more advanced Guitar Building and Songwriting Training, School of Rock offers opportunities for musicians of all skill levels. Camps vary by location, so please contact us for a current list of camps and workshops at School of Rock Somerville.

Regardless of which camp they choose, students can expect: 
• Hands-on skill building for guitar, bass guitar, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals 
• One-on-one interaction with seasoned music professionals 
• A deeper appreciation for music theory and fundamentals 
• Greater confidence, collaboration and improvisation abilities 
• A fun and interactive experience
customByName.Program Text - LittleWing:
At School of Rock Somerville, we teach preschoolers in our Little Wing Program the creativity, confidence, and knowledge they need to grow into life-long lovers and practitioners of music. Music is the gateway to childrens’ growth, whether it’s in the form of great friendships from shared musical experiences or the joy of hearing an inspirational song for the first time.

Our Little Wing students at Somerville enjoy a unique variety of music-minded games based on some of the most popular music in rock and roll history. Through great music and a foundation of fun, our students refine their motor skills, coordination, pre-literacy, and group cooperation in a safe and inclusive environment.

Young rockers in Somerville’s Little Wing Program can expect:  

• Exploration of hand percussion and other tools to spark their imagination
• Unique and engaging music games
• Teamwork, cooperation, and group music activities
• Fundamental skills for music and life
• Fun and practical learning combined, perfectly tailored to growing minds!
customByName.Program Text - Performanc:
At School of Rock Somerville, our Performance Program puts our students front-and-center on a real stage for real performances. Students get to show off their killer music skills while learning serious teamwork as they and their bandmates refine their abilities through some of rock and roll’s greatest hits.

Somerville students will blow your mind with advanced performances chock-full of hits by famous artists such as Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, Van Halen, The Rolling Stones, AC/DC, Frank Zappa, Queen, and many, many more! For our students, real performances breed real skill, and real fun. 

All students in Somerville’s Performance Program can expect:

• Weekly private music lessons on guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals
• Weekly band rehearsal to get students prepared for real shows
• The experience of performing on stage with their band at real venues
• Key learning in fundamental areas such as stage performance, harmonies, musicianship, and more
• Fun, music, and education wrapped into one all-inclusive experience!
customByName.Program Text - Rock 101:
School of Rock Somerville’s Rock 101 Program encourages fun and success for our younger students as they begin their journey. The days of traditional instruction with piles of sheet music are over. At School of Rock Somerville, we believe that playing real music is the only path to proficiency and a true appreciation for music. 

In Rock 101, students select one instrument to study, and we begin teaching fundamentals: scales, chords, notes, time signatures, and all the rest. Our unique approach to music instruction teaches our students vital fundamentals through songs they know and love, not rote memorization. With real musical context in a fun environment, we give all of our students the knowledge they need to really pursue their passion for music.

All students in Somerville’s Rock 101 Program can expect:  

• Weekly private music lessons on guitar, bass, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals
• Weekly group rehearsals to reinforce the fundamentals in a team environment
• A firm grasp of the basics of music theory and technique 
• An understanding of what it means to play solo and in a group
• Real knowledge gained through real fun!
customByName.Program Text - Rookies:
School of Rock Somerville’s Rookies Program offers a gateway to understanding music for first and second graders. Using proprietary set-ups for guitar, bass, drums and keyboard, as well as other tools, we introduce our Rookies to music fundamentals in a fun way. The skills and passion for music that our Rookies learn prepares them for Rock 101 and a lifelong love of music.

With exercises, tools and games customized to their age group, our (geomodifer) Rookies learn the concepts of music theory, rhythm, pitch, form and dynamics as they play alongside their friends. We encourage our students to explore various instruments and play styles so they begin to understand how individual contributions form a band; even the best solo keyboard players or vocalists need to understand how an ensemble works.

All students in Somerville’s Rookies Program can expect:  

• Weekly group lessons using guitar, bass, keyboard and drums
• Exposure to essential fundamentals like music theory, pitch and rhythm
• A focus on teamwork and collaboration
• An understanding of what it means to play solo and in a group
• Fun combined with practical learning!

You have created something special there, and I hope you understand what an impact your efforts have had on the lives of these children.Thank you for everything!

custom.8301:
School of Rock San Pedro’s music camps and workshops are designed to bring out the best performance in a fast-paced learning environment. Just like our standard programs, our camps offer a high-energy experience that is fun, creative and team-oriented. Our students learn music by playing it with their peers, guided by experienced instructors from the music community.

From basic Performance Boot Camps to more advanced Guitar Building and Songwriting Training, School of Rock offers opportunities for musicians of all skill levels. Camps vary by location, so please contact us for a current list of camps and workshops at School of Rock San Pedro.

Regardless of which camp they choose, students can expect: 
• Hands-on skill building for guitar, bass guitar, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals 
• One-on-one interaction with seasoned music professionals 
• A deeper appreciation for music theory and fundamentals 
• Greater confidence, collaboration and improvisation abilities 
• A fun and interactive experience

Message Carousel Photo 1.description: En la School of Rock, ofrecemos un enfoque único en la enseñanza de la música que ayuda a los niños a desarrollarse de maneras inimaginables. Nuestro programa de performance permite que cada niño participante tenga la oportundiad de trabajar con un equipo y presentarse en vivo en un escenario.  Y durante este proceso, aprenden a esforzarse por cumplir una meta, salir de su zona de confort y destrozar una estrofa de "Kashmir".

Message Carousel Photo 3.description: Los días de la enseñanza musical vieja y aburrida y las pilas de partituras se terminaron. En School of Rock, creemos que tocar música verdadera es el único camino para lograr el dominio y la apreciación duradera. A nuestros experimentados instructores les apasiona crear un legado de música para el futuro al ayudar a sus niños a tener éxito.

Message Carousel Photo 4.description: Ofrecemos programas para todos los niveles de la experiencia musical. A partir de 101 hasta AllStars, nuestra finalidad es equipar a los aspirantes a músicos con las herramientas correctas para convertirse en artistas apasionados y exitosos en el marco del mundo real.

customByName.Meta Keywords: School of Rock, San Pedro, San Pedro Garza Garcia, Países Bajos, guitarra, clases de música, banda de rock, batería, piano, canto, bajo
customByName.News Item 1 - Body: School of Rock México ha integrado a su staff de socios estratégicos a un grupo de músicos, artistas y creativos que contribuirán al impulso y desarrollo de una nueva generación de jóvenes innovadores mexicanos. Además de fLIP Tamez (Jumbo) contará con el apoyo de Alan Robles (Rock n Tour), Camilo Lara (Productor Musical / IMS), Cha (Fobia / Moderatto), Chetes, Chicle (Mr.Woo), Javier Montemayor (Sei Track), Phil Vinall (Productor Musical), Rafael Sarmiento (Productor TV), Rodrigo Dávila (Motel), así como Rodrigo, Leónn, Angel, Chucho y Sergio integrantes de Zoé.
customByName.News Item 1 - Title: School of Rock anuncia nuevos socios en México
customByName.Pages Description:
Bienvenidos a la School of Rock San Pedro.

Nuestra meta es ayudar a desarrollar el potencial artístico de nuestros alumnos, llevarlos al escenario frente a la mayor cantidad de personas posible y contribuir al desarrollo de una nueva generación de increíbles músicos y personas creativas.

Además nos enfocamos a crear experiencias únicas para nuestros alumnos y desarrollar su confianza en si mismos, sus habilidades de trabajo en equipo y liderazgo.

School of Rock, fundada en 1998 en Filadelfia es la primer escuela de música basada en ejecución. Actualmente contamos con más de 170 escuelas en nueve países.
customByName.Program Text - Adult Prog:
En la School of Rock San Pedro, sabemos cómo llevar el mundo de la música y toda la diversión que conlleva, a los estudiantes adultos. Nuestros alumnos tocan y aprenden a velocidad como de rayo por medio de interpretaciones reales de sus canciones favoritas, en vez de los anticuados programas comunes y corrientes de instrucción musical con montañas de partituras y hora tras hora de memorización de las notas. En la School of Rock San Pedro, el escenaio puede ser suyo a cualquier edad.

Nuestros estudiantes adultos aprenden los aspectos fundamentales de la música, incluyendo escalas, cuerdas, notas, progresiones y más, a partir de la enseñanza en el mundo real a través de las canciones más impactantes y sonidos en la historial musical. Sea cual sea su gusto musical, nuestros instructores saben cómo crear un programa perfecto para usted. Ya sea que busque adquirir las aptitudes básicas, que quiera un lugar como el guitarrista residente de las fiestas, o busque el estatus de futura estrella del rock, la School of Rock San Pedro es muy diligente para ayudarle a lograr sus metas.

Todos los alumnos del Adult Program de la School of Rock San Pedro pueden esperar lo siguiente:

• Enseñanza acelerada en uno de nuestras grandiosas ofertas musicales: guitarra, bajo, batería, teclado y canto
• Instrucción semanal privada orientada hacia sus metas y su nivel de aptitud
• Una comprensión firme de los aspectos fundamentales de la técnica y la teoría musical.
• Aprender y tocar bien con su género musical favorito
• Diversión, aprendizaje y un gran progreso de destrezas prácticas, ¡todo en uno!
customByName.Program Text - AllStars:
Nuestros mejores artistas pueden hacer audiciones para lograr la distinción más prestigiosa de la School of Rock San Pedro: ¡un sitio en nuestro programa All Stars! All Stars de la School of Rock representa la crema y nata de la red global de escuelas y alumnos de School of Rock. Nuestros participantes de All Stars cuentan con increíbles capacidades musicales y un talento muy importante para el asombroso trabajo en equipo; tienen las destrezas y el impuso para convertirse en la próxima generación de la grandeza musical.

Cada veran, nuestros participantes de All Stars se embarcan en un tour de conciertos auténtico, que incluye autobuses para el tour, y viven una experiencia única en su tipo. Nuestros músicos de San Pedro hacen interpretaciones con bandas de All Star en múltiples shows en vivo por todo el país. Nuestros estudiantes de All Stars se han presentado en Red Rocks, Lollapalooza, Hangout Music Fest (festival musical), Namm, Gathering of the Vibes (reunión de las vibras) y muchísimos más. All Stars también comparten el escenario y aprenden de las experimentadas leyendas eternas como Alice Cooper, Eddie Vedder y Slash, por mencionar a unos cuantos. El programa All Stars de School of Rock ofrece una oportunidad como ninguna: aprender a estremecer el escenario para audiencias reales.

Todos los participantes de All Stars en la School of Rock San Pedro pueden esperar lo siguiente:

• Presentaciones de la vida real donde pueden sobresalir en el medio que prefieran: guitarra, bajo, batería, teclado y canto
• Una excelente improvisación y colaboración con su banda
• Un verano lleno de aprendizaje genial y práctico
• Desarrollo de técnicas instrumentales avanzadas
• ¡Una experiencia rockera verdaderamente épica, como ninguna otra!
customByName.Program Text - Camps:
School of Rock San Pedro’s music camps and workshops are designed to bring out the best performance in a fast-paced learning environment. Just like our standard programs, our camps offer a high-energy experience that is fun, creative and team-oriented. Our students learn music by playing it with their peers, guided by experienced instructors from the music community.

From basic Performance Boot Camps to more advanced Guitar Building and Songwriting Training, School of Rock offers opportunities for musicians of all skill levels. Camps vary by location, so please contact us for a current list of camps and workshops at School of Rock San Pedro.

Regardless of which camp they choose, students can expect: 
• Hands-on skill building for guitar, bass guitar, keyboard, drums, and/or vocals 
• One-on-one interaction with seasoned music professionals 
• A deeper appreciation for music theory and fundamentals 
• Greater confidence, collaboration and improvisation abilities 
• A fun and interactive experience
customByName.Program Text - LittleWing:
Nuestros alumnos de preescolar en Little Wing en la School of Rock San Pedro aprenden la creatividad, confianza y experiencia duradera que necesitan para convertirse en amantes de por vida y practicantes de la música. Nuestro enfoque exclusivo de la educación musical abre nuevas puertas a la diversión y el entusiasmo para los niños, desde el trabajo en equipo hasta el gusto por tocar rock con su instrumento favorito. Creamos un ambiente seguro e incluyente donde la música y el aprendizaje van de la mano para promover un desarrollo asombroso en nuestros Rookies de San Pedro.

Los alumnos de Little Wing en la School of Rock San Pedro disfrutan de una amplia selección de juegos basados en música en algunas de las melodías del rock and roll más reconocidas de la historia. Con una música estupenda, con la diversión como base y en un ambiente que fomena amistades de verdad, nuestros alumnos tienen la oportunidad de desarrollarse como en ninguna otra parte.

Todos los alumnos del programa Little Wing de San Pedro pueden esperar lo siguiente:  

• Exploración de los instrumentos de pequeña percusión y otras herramientas para desatar su imaginación
• Juegos musicales únicos y cautivadores
• Trabajo en equipo, cooperación y actividades musicales en grupo
• Destrezas fundamentales para la música y la vida
• Combinación de diversión y aprendizaje práctico, perfectamente acoplados para las mentes en desarrollo
customByName.Program Text - Performanc:
En la School of Rock San Pedro, nuestro programa Performance pone a nuestros alumnos en el centro del escenario real para dar verdaderos espectáculos. Los estudiantes demuestran su excelente talento musical a la vez que aprenden a trabajar en equipo en serio, mientras ellos y los miembros de su banda refinan sus habilidades a través de los grandes hits del rock and roll.

Los alumnos de San Pedro le harán explotar la cabeza con intrepetaciones magistrales de los mejores hits de artistas famosos como Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, Van Halen, AC/DC, Devo, Frank Zappa, Queen y muchos, muchos más. Para nuestros estudiantes, las presentaciones reales les ayudan a desarrollar sus destrezas, y además se divierten. 

Todos los alumnos del programa Performance de San Pedro pueden esperar lo siguiente:

• Clases semanales privadas de guitarra, bajo, teclado, batería y canto
• Ensayos semanales con la banda para prepararlos para los conciertos de verdad
• Enseñanza clave en áreas fundamentales como desempeño en el escenario, armonía, maestría musical y más
• Diversión, música y educación, todo envuelto en una experiencia integral.
customByName.Program Text - Rock 101:
El programa Rock 101 de School of Rock San Pedro trata de equipar a los músicos aspirantes con las destrezas que necesitan para convertirse en intérpretes apasionados y exitosos. Los días de la enseñanza tradicional musical vieja se terminaron. En School of Rock San Pedro, creemos que la improvisación en el mundo real es el único camino para lograr la maestría y un amor verdadero hacia la música.

Sabemos que nuestros estudiantes necesitan conocer las reglas antes de torcerlas y romperlas para crear nuevas clases de innovación musical. Ya sea que les enseñemos escalas, cuerdas, notas o compases, ponemos los conceptos en contexto para que los alumnos conozcan la manera en que los principios que aprenden se aplican a la música real por músicos verdaderos. Utilizando algunas de las canciones más famosas del mundo, e infundiendo diversión a cada nota, Rock 101 San Pedro abre las puertas de la música a los alumnos.

Los alumnos del programa Rock 101 de San Pedro pueden esperar lo siguiente:  

• Clases semanales privadas de guitarra, bajo, teclado, batería y canto
• Ensayos grupales semanales con la banda por toda la diversión y colaboración que encuentran en una banda
• Una comprensión firme de los aspectos fundamentales de la técnica y la teoría musical.
• Un entendimiento de lo que significa tocar solo y en un grupo
• Conocimiento real adquirido a través de experiencias realmente divertidas
customByName.Program Text - Rookies:
El programa Rookies de la School of Rock San Pedro ofrece la introducción perfecta a la música para rockeros pequeños, entre los 6 y 7 años. Con un enfoque en interpretación estructurada en grupo y la adopción de nuestra oferta instrumental completa, nuestros "principiantes" salen de este programa listos para unirse a las grandes ligas en Rock 101. Las destrezas y la pasión por la música que enseñamos a nuestros alumnos los llena de un entusiasmo suficiente para lograr una apreciación musical duradera.

Nuestros Rookies de San Pedro practican ejercicios para el entrenamiento del oído adecuados para su edad y fáciles de aplicar, así como la estructura de las canciones, el ritmo básico y más mientras tocan junto con sus amigos. Animamos a nuestros alumnos a que exploren varios instrumentos y estilos de interpretación para que puedan familiarizarse con todas las partes del paisaje musical; incluso los guitarristas solistas o bateristas más asombrosos necesitan entender cómo funciona el resto de la banda en forma integral.

Todos los alumnos del programa Rookies de San Pedro pueden esperar lo siguiente:  

• Clases semanales en grupo de toda nuestra oferta musical, que incluye guitarra, bajo, teclado, batería y canto
• Exposición a los aspectos fundamentales de la música
• Un enfoque en el trabajo en equipo y la colaboración
• Un entendimiento de lo que significa tocar solo y en un grupo
• ¡Diversión mezclada con enseñanza práctica!
customByName.Testimonial 1 - Body: School of Rock has taught me how to perform in public with self-confidence.
customByName.Testimonial 2 - Body: School of Rock. The best music school anywhere. This whole idea of getting kids not just taking lessons and learning notes and chords, but learning songs and playing with other young musicians, and getting out on stage… I was so impressed that my daughter Cheyenne goes to School of Rock on Long Island.
customByName.Testimonial 3 - Body: You want your kid to be passionate about something, whether it be sports, scouts, dance or whatever. School of Rock does this for my son. We have discovered a talent we didn't know he had. My son would live at School of Rock if he could. We’ve already recommended the program to several friends.
customByName.Testimonial 4 - Body: Our son explored many other extra-curricular activities prior to SOR, and no other activity was able to keep his interest. He has been challenged with new material, gained a foundation in theory and songwriting, as well as learned how to work in a group with other students to put on phenomenal rock 'n roll concerts in real" concert venues."
